description: For my master's, I worked in the Lab of Dr. Edina Rosta. It was my first foray into computational sciences and I thoroughly enjoyed it. I Wrote code in Python for the analysis of biomolecule simulations. Specifically, we investigated protein-ligand unbinding using Molecular dynamics simulations. XXXXThe work has since been published in JCTC:

images.description: the simulated system, complete with the membrane. GPCR with bound ligand.
The idea behind the simulations: inter-atomic distances were selected for tracking and analysis. These would be used to estimate the energy of the interaction.

description: I did my PhD in the lab of Gioacchino Natoli, in the European Institute of Oncology, in Milan. Our work was focused on transcription regulation in higher eukaryotes. As a dry lab scientist, this involved building end-to-end pipelines for data processing and subsequent analysis, for which I wrote custom scripts in bash, R and python. XXXXHowever, my work didn't stop there. I read papers and discussed science extensively with my colleagues in order to design smart, targeted experiments that would give us the answers we need.
